name: Sanchuan Chen
content: Sanchuan Chen Assistant Professor Computer Science Auburn University Office: 3116 Shelby Center Phone: 334 844 4756 Email: schen@auburn.edu Citations                    Lab Website About I am an Assitant Professor at Auburn University Computer Science Department. I am also a faculty member of Auburn University Center for Artificial Intelligence and Cybersecurity Engineering (AU-CAICE). I lead the Secure and Confidential Computing Lab at Auburn. I completed my Ph.D. in Computer Science at The Ohio State University supervised by Professor Zhiqiang Lin and Professor Yinqian Zhang. I received my M.E. degree from Institute of Software, Chinese Academy of Sciences and B.E.degree from University of Science and Technology of China. Research Interests Software Security Machine Learning Security Hardware Security Cryptanalysis News July, 2025: Serve in the Program Committee of Network and Distributed System Security (NDSS) Symposium 2026.. July, 2025: Serve in the Program Committee of 24th International Conference on Applied Cryptography and Network Security (ACNS 2026).. June, 2025: Serve in the Program Committee of 35th USENIX Security Symposium (USENIX Security 2026). June, 2025: Our Extractions of NLP models with Derivative Analysis was presented at DARPA Resilient Software Systems Colloquium. March, 2025: Serve in the Program Committee of International Conference on Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering (EASE). October, 2024: Our data privacy paper An Enhanced and Robust Data Publishing Scheme for Private and Useful 1:M Microdata was accepted by the IEEE Transactions on Big Data. October, 2024: Serve in the Program Committee of 32th ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS 2025). Please submit your best work! August, 2024: Serve in the Program Committee of 45th IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems (IEEE ICDCS 2025). Please submit your best work! July, 2024: Serve in the Program Committee of 34th USENIX Security Symposium (USENIX Security 2025). Please submit your best work! January, 2024: Serve in the Program Committee of 31th ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS 2024). Please submit your best work! January, 2024: Serve in the Program Committee of 33rd USENIX Security Symposium (USENIX Security 2024). Please submit your best work! January, 2024: Serve as Sponsorship and Exhibits Chair of International Conference on Edge Computing and IoT: Systems, Management and Security (EAI ICECI 2024). January, 2024: Serve in the Program Committee of IEEE International Conference on Mobile Adhoc and Sensor Systems (MASS 2024). January, 2024: Serve in the Program Committee of EAI International Conference on Security and Privacy in Cyber-Physical Systems and Smart Vehicles (SmartSP 2024). June, 2023: Serve in the Program Committee of 19th International Conference on Mobility, Sensing and Networking (MSN 2023). May, 2023: Invited to present my research at Shanghai Jiao Tong University Computer Science Department. February, 2023: Serve in the Program Committee of 19th EAI International Conference on Security and Privacy in Communication Networks (SecureComm 2023). November 2022: Our data race detection paper Controlled Data Races in Enclaves: Attacks and Detection was accepted by the 32th USENIX Security Symposium (USENIX Security'23). July, 2022: Serve in the Program Committee of 18th International Conference on Information Security and Cryptology (Inscrypt 2022). May, 2022: Serve in the Program Committee of 28th IEEE International Conference on Parallel and Distributed Systems (ICPADS 2022). December, 2021: Serve in the Program Committee of 18th EAI International Conference on Security and Privacy in Communication Networks (SecureComm 2022). January 2021: Our binary analysis paper SelectiveTaint: Efficient Data Flow Tracking With Static Binary Rewriting was accepted by the 30th USENIX Security Symposium (USENIX Security'21). Publication Extractions of NLP models with Derivative Analysis Xueqing Zhang, Sanchuan Chen, Chaoyue Liu DARPA Resilient Software Systems Colloquium. Lee, Haibo Chen, XiaoFeng Wang AsiaCCS'18, Incheon, Korea, Jun. 2018. Racing in Hyperspace: Closing Hyper-Threading Side Channels on SGX with Contrived Data Races [pdf][slides][bib] Guoxing Chen & Wenhao Wang, Tianyu Chen, Sanchuan Chen, Yinqian Zhang, XiaoFeng Wang, Ten-Hwang Lai, Dongdai Lin Oakland'18, San Francisco, USA, May. 2018.
